main event: A civilian in Washington, D.C. reported observing a bright object in the sky that appeared to be moving faster than a normal star for about 1 hour and 15 minutes.
interesting points: The object was initially thought to be a star, but it appeared to move slowly towards the northeast at a faster rate of speed than a normal star.
The object was as large as an aircraft and had a yellowish color, like a star.
The object was constantly in and out of clouds and was observed moving in different directions, including up and down.
The observer was a 35-year-old man from Falls Church, Virginia who was described as critical, senior, sober, and very reliable.
The sighting was eventually attributed to the release of a weather balloon from the Washington National Airport, which was observed by the Andrews Air Force Base tower personnel.
sighted object: a bright, yellowish object in the sky
